str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleion; to do, make or be more, i.e. Increase; by extension, to superabound.

parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Even as, just as. From katha and per; exactly as.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
